author: {'steamid': '76561198113805058', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 130, 'playtime_forever': 91, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 91, 'last_played': 1679867020}
review:
Played using HTC Vive Pro/Index controllers/RTX2060Super

Nice small, sort of, escape room game.
The graphics look nice, and everything runs pretty smooth.
I did ran into a few small bugs.
-Sometimes the 'Mechanical room' objective doesn't seem to pass, even though you got the robot fully up and runnning.
-In my first playthrough the button game was just dropping over and over through the room and no way of actually playing it.

But the 'puzzles' are pretty easy.

Paid the current full price of 2,99 euro's and I think it is worth it for the 30-45 minutes it takes. Sadly no achievements, which in this case would have been nice. and no real extra if you even got all goals done (at least I didn't notice anything), and that's a bit sad. As far as I know you can't go down the hatch and as I said it also doesn't seem to open when you got all goals.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001813417', 'num_games_owned': 457, 'num_reviews': 850, 'playtime_forever': 39, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 39, 'last_played': 1499793901}
review:
Dwingle: B.O.T von XXII Group ist ein ziemlich schwarzhumoriges Escaperoomspiel. Eingesperrt in einer Hütte zusammen mit einem psychopatischem  Roboter mit französischem Akzent, der nur zu Beginn der Aufgabe freundlich zu ein scheint. Das Spiel hat durch diesen storiebasierenden Ansatz fast schon ein Alleinstellungsmerkmal unter den Escaperoomspielen.  Die Rätsel sind  nicht immer gleich ersichtlich, da sie meist auf anderen Hinweisen aufbauen. Am Ende des Raums gibt es aber eine To-Do-Liste, auf der etwas verklausuliert steht, was noch zu tun ist. Es gibt wirklich viel Zeug zum angrapschen und viele Dinge haben auf den ersten Blick  gar keinen Zweck ...

Wieder ein kurzweiliger Escaperoomspaß

Mehr verspielte Reviews:
https://store.steampowered.com/curator/32170554/

+ Few optional achievements

- Require holding grip buttons - not comfortable with the current Vive controllers
- Very short
- Minor bugs - sometimes physics go crazy, performance issues when watching cartoon (even with GTX 1080), [spoiler]I bought a fuse in advance, but when I needed it, it disappeared and I had to find the one I was supposed to find anyway[/spoiler]

• I'm quite disappointed it turned into a horror game. Building and teaching your own robot would be much nicer and may last longer. This way, I don't know who is its target audience - the first half for kids, the second one for those who like escape room horrors?

[b]Movement[/b]: 		Teleportation
[b]Controls[/b]: 		Motion controllers

[b]My progress[/b]: 		1 hour, finished (1x)
[b]Recommended price[/b]: 	1-5 €

[u]My overall recommendation score: [b]50%[/b][/u]

author: {'steamid': '76561198075749547', 'num_games_owned': 88, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 41, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 41, 'last_played': 1501942778}
review:
Thought this was a fun little game with an unexpected twist. 

Quite polished looking, simple concept with games/escape room style things to work out, although these don't always affect progression. I finished the game with still quite a few unsolved things left. Took me about 40mins to finish the game, seen other people take an hour or two, just depends how much you mess around in it. 

The robot has quite a strong French accent, which combined with having a 'robot voice' made it quite hard to understand what it was saying at times, which is a shame, because I bet this is why I didn't solve some things as the robot gives you hints, but if you can't understand the hints, that's not going to help. Also some of the objects I was interacting with just flipped out which was annoying at times. 

But even with those few negative points, I'd still recommend playing it. I think it's priced sensibly which makes a nice change. Not a lot of replay value, but would be fun to demo to people and see their reactions.

Here's my playthrough if you want to see what's what:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7r8zMV0FaTI

review: I kinda liked this game. It isn't anywhere near my favourite but it has its charm. It is essentially an escape experience combined with a pet simulator. The game is very short but it delivers a nice story during this period. The only real problem with it in my opinion is that, it took me way too much time to figure out that it was an escape, other than that, it was great and I definetly recomend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197982933202', 'num_games_owned': 951, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 52, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 19, 'last_played': 1500607559}
review:
Pretty cool game, some of the sounds (Robot assembling electric sound in particular) could use some updating or variations.  The game itself is actually pretty unique and the robot is cute and has interesting reactions.  The puzzles are clue-based style and tracked on a board that lights up when a puzzle has been completed.  Lots of items to tinker with and feels very feature rich in the short time ive played so far.

I give this a thumbs up, but it does appear to need some additional work as during day 3 the robot stopped responding to me and I had to reload.  

Very worth the price for a great looking, interactive, puzzly game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004639217', 'num_games_owned': 274, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 110, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 45, 'last_played': 1530554831}

author: {'steamid': '76561198095825079', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 85, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 66, 'last_played': 1556741558}

author: {'steamid': '76561197987747208', 'num_games_owned': 297, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 60, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 58, 'last_played': 1515374395}
review:
I tenatively recommend this game. They are on the right track and the story looks like it could evolve into something interesting.  Experiences like this is why I wanted VR, not for just another shooter. I look forward to seeing the ending if I can get through without it crashing. 

Pros:
Fair price
good graphics
interesting experience and atmosphere
puzzles
paced story development

cons:
Maybe should have launched as early access?
1 hour played, two game sessions. both game sessions ended due to bugs. 
Robot has a strong french(?) accent, it adds character but also makes him difficult to understand at times.
You interact with the environment more than you do the robot directly. 

Note: This gets a little creepy. Consider that a warning for the sensitive.

With a little polish and patches this could turn out to be really good!
